snippet: The tallying of the national elections must stop, about two-thirds of the 30 Central African Republic presidential candidates said Monday, alleging fraud.
abstract: About 20 of Central African Republic's presidential candidates demand halt to tallying of national elections in news conference citing fraud and irregularities; almost 40 percent of the country's votes have been counted thus far.
lead_paragraph: The tallying of the national elections must stop, about two-thirds of the 30 Central African Republic presidential candidates said Monday, alleging fraud.

headline.main: Central African Republic: A Call by Candidates to Halt Vote Count
headline.print_headline: Africa; Central African Republic: A Call by Candidates to Halt Vote Count
